titleInfo.title: Map of Louisiana, 6th judicial district, 1808. (and surveyor's notes)

mods.abstract: Certified copy of property survey map originally created by Pintado in 1808. Original map in Spanish; notes on certified copy in English. 'Seal of office in the City of New Orleans this 25th day of January 1843 year of our Lord and the Sixty-seventh of the Independence of the U.S of America. (Signed) Bringier, Surveyor Genl.' 'A true copy of the document on file in my office. December 26th, 1846.' Pintado explains (in Spanish) the difficulties he encountered on this project. Far right upper (southeast) area of map shows unattached territory (Crown lands). Remainder of area (north, east, and west) in private hands, owned by Dominique Bouligny, Ursino Bouligny, Gilberto Andry, and Jean Baptiste Labatut.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Access to unprocessed collections requires the permission of the curator, subject to Special Collections' Policy on Access to Unprocessed Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/about/unprocessed.html)
mods.note: William Waller Survey Collection, Mss. 3592, 3910, 4326, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.
